subtitles.transcript: We also have in place a whole set of protocols around what and how a gift can set conditions
and what the limits are to the use of a gift of any kind to either direct research or, for that matter,
buy institutional favors. We have a complete firewall between our admissions and philanthropy,
and we have a complete firewall in the sense that we don’t even, to the dismay of some of our alums,
take legacy into account when students apply for admission. So again, there’s a kind of almost over-determination
to the extent to which this particular institution encodes its public mission and its public being
that, again, doesn’t have a great deal to do with how much money Sacramento
is giving us. It has to do with a whole bunch of other things.
